Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Posterior Pericardiotomy for Prevention of Postoperative Atrial Fibrillation

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults undergoing cardiac surgery, randomised to receive PP or standard care.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive PP or standard care

Objective.evidence: This study aims to describe POAF characteristics and evaluate the effect of posterior pericardiotomy (PP) on POAF incidence.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of POAF within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 420 patients were randomised, 210 to PP and 210 to control, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: PP significantly reduced POAF incidence (17.7% vs 31.3%; p=0.001)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
